After lunch in Paia town, we drove 10 more minutes to Ho'okipa Beach to spend the day reading, swimming, and relaxing. 🌊 A little boy kept coming over to us and playing. His mom called him over and we realized he has the same name we want to name our baby!! Needless to say, we took this as a sign that our baby is going to love the beach, sun and happiness as much as we do 🏄🏻🤰🏻

TOFU. 🌱 You either LOVE it or you HATE it. Which side do you fall on? I love it - ever since my years as a vegan (2008 - 2011ish), I’ve always incorporated it into my diet. The key is to avoid that slippery, spongy tofu that we all think about when we think tofu. I’m sharing my THREE favorite ways to bake tofu (hint: balsamic, soy, and sesame crusted.) To grab the recipes, click the link in our profile 👆🏼 And let me know if you like these simple tutorial/how-to blog posts and if they’re helpful - your feedback is always appreciated 🙏🏼

You know I love a good before and after, and I figured I’d share this one, for those who need a bit of Friday inspiration! In this photo, I want to point out what matters most: finding your healthiest and happiest self. I’m not talking about the 30 pound weight loss, I’m talking about taking control of your own destiny and committing to being happy. And healthy. While I’ve always had a sunny disposition, I had never truly found happiness with my health and body. Since I was about 18 or 19, I was always yo-yo dieting, fad-dieting, and just... dieting. In the before photo (on the left), I was about 170 pounds and miserable. I didn’t know how to dress my body, all I wanted to do was cover it up. I didn’t have my own style, because I didn’t feel comfortable wearing trends. I didn’t even feel comfortable walking into the trendy stores, I was terribly insecure. Most importantly, I didn’t physically feel good, I was always tired and uncomfortable. I’d wake up with food comas 5 out of 7 days of the week and was living a very unhealthy, unbalanced lifestyle. Fast forward to the present (literally, this photo on the right was taken yesterday) and my life has changed dramatically. Not only have I reached my healthiest and happiest self, I’ve found my own personal style and I can finally have fun with the trends (like off the shoulder tops and high-waisted denim.) Confidence is the sexiest accessory, of course, but it comes with being happy with yourself, inside and out. Every day I wake up, I feel like I’m helping others find their healthy stride, and I’m nourishing my mind, body, and soul. I started @alissandrab mainly to catalogue this new chapter in my life, and I hope you all follow along and hopefully, it’ll inspire those of you who are on a similar journey. And don’t get me wrong, it’s a never-ending journey, but now, for the first time in my life, I’m looking forward to the journey, bumps in the road and all. Thanks for all your positivity and encouragement, I wrote about it in my new cookbook

I will never forget this moment, as I walked towards the aisle, about to marry the man of my dreams. My father and I tried to make each other laugh so that we wouldn't cry. It only lasted 30 seconds until our feet hit the aisle and he started sobbing, but I'm so happy @nadyafurnariphoto captured this moment. My dad was telling me, "We're not going to cry, we'll just walk nice and slow. I can't believe this is happening." I love you Dad and even though we butt heads because we're the same person, I can't complain, because we're pretty cool peeps. HAPPY BIRTHDAY!!!!!! Can't wait to celebrate with 🍰 at home tonight (and yes, my parents' house will always be "home" -- shh, don't tell @yolyslu)! 🎉

Today, I was reminded of a powerful mantra that I follow in my fit journey: one "bad day" won't ruin everything you've worked for, and the recovery is what's important. Last night, I had a few glasses of rose and one too many @justins dark chocolate peanut butter cups (like, 6). I woke up feeling somewhat discouraged but then I focused on my recovery and had a killer @pelotoncycle spin class, followed by 20 minutes of upper and lower body lifting. Now, I feel refreshed, strong and like last night never happened. I'm going to focus on hydrating and eating clean for the rest of today. Long story short, don't let "bad days" keep you from your goals: being healthy is a lifestyle and sometimes, life throws curve balls (or, chocolate)! Happy Friday 👊🏻 @underarmourwomen

The best tip I got when I first started cooking was to keep a large bowl near your prep area for trash. A messy cook myself, this advice has been invaluable and makes cooking more enjoyable, organized and frankly less stressful! Every time I cook, I use this Wake Forest popcorn bowl my parents bought for me my freshman year of college - it's been through 4 years of college and 5 different apartments! What's your favorite cooking tip someone once gave you? And go Deacs!! Class of 2009!!

I could not have said this better myself, so no further commentary needed except I will say two things: 1) My sister and I literally couldn't stop talking about how fit and amazing Gaga looked as she crushed her performance last night and 2) Thank you for keeping it real, @jessraeking. The world needs more real, positive role models like you out there. I’m now a new follower 🙋🏻 -------- Repost @jessraeking 👉🏼
💥💃Big Gaga fan, so of course I taped the super bowl just to see her perform. As always, she absolutely killed it but when I went onto Facebook after the half time show I couldn't believe some of the sh*t I was reading. Comments about her stomach (?!?) in particular one terrible person said that they were "distracted by the flab on her stomach swinging around". 😱
It gets worse from here- I then go onto Instagram where I find that the shots from her performance have already been photoshopped- left original- right retouched. 👎🏼
What kind of world do we live in where someone has gone and retouched Gaga deeming her natural healthy body unacceptable?! I hate that we are talking about her body and not her crazy talent, determination or values. 👸🏼
Seriously this woman is a Queen and anyone who has anything negative to say about her body deserves to have their face stepped on by one of her Swarovski encrusted high- heeled boots. The end.💁🏼

It’s the weekend, which means that Lu’s home and he can help with the baby and I can get some work done! 👶🏻👪 Cooked and photographed my first blog recipe since I went on maternity leave -- it felt good to get back to it, and an easy Thanksgiving side dish is now coming your way tomorrow, featuring spiralized butternut squash and lentils! 🙌🏼 🦃 Popped that in the fridge for dinner later and then made my quick Avocado Tuna Salad (you can see it on IG stories) for lunch. 🥑 Many of you asked for the recipe, so here it is:
+
Avocado Tuna Salad
Makes 2 large servings
+
1/2 large avocado
1 can chunk lite tuna in water
1.5 teaspoons Dijon mustard
1 celery stalk, diced
1/4 cup diced red onion
salt and pepper
+
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix together until avocado is mashed and the mixture is spreadable (I like it on toast!) Enjoy! 🍽
+

Happpyyy Monday! ✍🏼 This week’s vibe is this: done is better than perfect. After speaking on a panel with two other female entrepreneurs this weekend at @wfuniversity, I realized that one of my best qualities as an entrepreneur is that I’m NOT a perfectionist. I don’t strive for perfection, and I never have! I strive for progress and just to be the best I can personally be. I don’t compare myself to others ever, because we’re all so unique, there’s room in this world for ALL of us to shine - and I’m constantly inspired by the drive and success of those around me! ✨SO. For those of you scared to press “publish” on your first blog post or launch your business because it’s not “perfect” yet, know this: you have to put something out there if you want to start. You’ll grow from the feedback. This can even apply to something as basic as a healthy diet. Don’t get discouraged just because you feel bloated and far from your goals. You just have to start! Erase perfection as an option and just strive to be better everyday. Get that project done, meet that incremental weight loss goal, because DONE is better than PERFECT, and that’s what’s going to get you closer to your happy place. The journey and the struggle is the everyday, so you need to make sure you’re enjoying it! Now, tag a friend who needs a nudge and then go crush your Monday! 👏🏼👊🏼

Today I spent Memorial Day with my family. Now I’m home with my husband and our little “family” (me, @yolyslu and Bart 🌵), feeling so grateful for family. There’s really nothing else that matters in life. Hope everyone had a wonderful Memorial Day with their families. ❤️

At this point, I was about to unbutton my pants- and we were only halfway through our starters. Wow. Tonight I had one of the best culinary experiences of my life at Arang Sate Bar, starting with the "Hot Stone Fish Sate Tasting," where they serve you six fish sate (seafood on a stick). Between the sates themselves and the side sauces and dips, the meal was unforgettable. We had heard so much about Mozaic, but after meandering along the main drag, this menu caught our attention most and we are SO happy we stepped in. The interior design, the music, the ambiance, the food... AMAZING. Afterwards we went to a bar where we had a vodka cocktail with fresh pineapple purée that was mind-blowing. The focus on healthy and real food here is refreshing! Ubud is turning out to be one of my favorite places on Earth. More on Snapchat and @alissandrab 🌴

True story: @acozykitchen was the first blog I ever read and the first blogger I ever reached out to for advice when I started blogging for inspiralized. Now, she made this 💣 recipe with @theinspiralizer and my world is complete. Well, it'll be complete once I get my hands on her new book

Before today, I had never cooked a full chicken or turkey. I finally decided to do it and this afternoon, I made the roast chicken from the new @plated cookbook. Being a total amateur cook, I didn’t place the bird breasts up, so they didn’t get that crispy skin they’re supposed to get. DOH! I thought about re-doing the whole thing, but I figured you might all appreciate this cooking blunder of mine (🙋🏻hi! I’m human!) Instead of being discouraged, I sliced the chicken up, served it over the spiralized potatoes I prepared, and it was still mind-blowingly delicious. Lesson learned: perfection isn’t necessary. DO your best, BE your best, and enjoy the stumbles in life (or in this case, the kitchen!) Embrace being a work in progress - that’s half the fun! And now, I’ll never improperly roast a chicken again! Recipe coming soon (and probably a long, wordy blog post.) 🙌🏻

If you're afraid to spiralize beets because they're messy - don't be! Wear gloves and immediately wash your spiralizer after you use it to prevent staining. And if you don't wear gloves and your hands get beet-red, just scrub them with table salt and rinse under warm water - the stains will rub off like magic! Snoozed HARD this morning. Lu and I went to an @xavierruddofficial concert last night in NYC with a bunch of friends and didn't get home until late (on a Monday?! 😩) I woke up CRAVING a green smoothie 🍵. Made my go-to:
✖️: 1/2 large frozen banana
✖️: 1 serving @vitalproteins marine collagen (2 scoops)
✖️: 1 tablespoon @yumbutter superfood almond butter ✖️: about 2 packed cups of organic baby spinach
✖️: a few ice cubes
✖️: about 1/4 cup cashew milk ✖️: about 1/4 cup frozen organic blueberries

Blend together and then top with about 1 teaspoon chia seeds and 1/4 cup of granola. I love putting it into a cup instead of a bowl, because it's easier to eat at my desk! 🙌🏼 Making my time-blocking schedule now to ensure a productive day! Happy Tuesday, loves ✌🏼

Where’s your happy place? 🧘🏻‍♀️ For me, that’s in the kitchen, cooking for myself, my family, and my friends. 👩🏻‍🍳Whether it's an intimate dinner for Lu and I or a boozy brunch with girlfriends, I feel most comfortable in the kitchen, cooking, with some music on (I love cooking to @miguel and @kendricklamar 🎵), and barefoot. I feel inspired, content, relaxed, and most importantly, fulfilled. ✖️
So tell me, where's your happy place? Is it on the treadmill (God bless! 🙏🏼)? On the yoga mat? In the pottery studio? Or is it just on the couch with your 🐶 or 🐱? Whatever it is, make extra time for it this weekend - we should all be in our happy places more often, it makes us more positive people. ✨ After all, you can't fill from an empty cup and you must take care of yourself first! That's why the flight attendants tell us to put our oxygen masks on before assisting others, right? Happy Friday! 😘

I'm reaaaally into quotes. 🙏🏼 I don't know why, but merely reading an inspirational quote can instantly change my mindset and set the pace for the rest of my day (or even week, month or year!) I'm always looking for new quotes when I need a little boost of inspiration, and I usually post them here when I find really good ones. Here are some of the ones that got me through 2017. ✍🏼 From these, I learned to be kinder on myself, push myself when I thought I couldn't, be resilient, seize opportunities, and be the healthiest version of myself. 💙 I can't wait to see what 2018 brings, and I'm sure it'll come with lots of new motivational quotes! 🎉 Share some inspiration in the comments below by sharing your favorite quote of 2017 - or tag a friend who may need some inspiration for the New Year!! 👇🏼 2018, we got this. 👊🏼

I'm pouring it all out on the blog today (again.) 🙏🏼 I'm talking about body positivity and the trick I've been using for the past 2-3 years that has been so effective and powerful: talking to yourself (aloud!) It seems awkward at first, but soon enough it becomes empowering and inspiring and helped me gain the healthy body confidence and self-love I carry with me everyday. 💪🏼 It's simple and if you're struggling with accepting your body and loving yourself the way you are, give it a try! I'm also talking about how gaining 5-10 more pounds than I probably needed to in this pregnancy has only made me love my body more and truly embrace it, kindly. This pregnancy has taught me so much about what's truly important in life (spoiler alert: it's not the distance between your thighs.) I ramble a lot in this blog post, but I mean every word of it and I hope it inspires some of you (🤰🏻 or not 🤰🏻) to start talking to yourself with kindness and strength! Link in profile to read 👆🏼

2017 will be the first year that I don't make a resolution to lose weight and reach a goal number on the scale. It will be the first year that my body isn't something I wish would change. As I was making a post about my "New Year's resolutions", I realized this and went through old photos to think back on each year and where I was at certain stages with my body. I came upon a photo of Lu and I at a wedding (pre marriage), where I specifically remember being in a beautiful place with wonderful friends with my amazing (now) husband and all I could think about was if I should have another canapé or not. Should I have another forkful of dessert. I was in constant mental battle with myself and the food I was eating and it's just such an empowering and liberating feeling to be at peace with (and proud of!) your body. The picture on the right was taken at our friends' wedding in Anguilla in November and there was no internal battles with food, all I thought about was the gorgeous wedding and the love in the air. I'll be sharing my 2017 resolutions on the blog in a couple of weeks and I just want everyone to know who wants to "get there" and be happy with their body is that what works is committing to a lifestyle, not a diet or 30 day plan. It's about saying to yourself, "This is the first day of the new me!" instead of "This is the first day of my diet." 💕

There are so many different ways to cook spiralized veggies - and it all depends on the veggie! 🌱 For example, if you want an al dente butternut squash noodle, it’s best to use Blade D on @theinspiralizer and toss it in a healthy oil over medium-high heat for 5-7 minutes until cooked to your preference (just taste a piece as you cook, like you would with ‘regular’ pasta!) 🍝 If you want a softer noodle, bake the butternut squash noodles in the oven at 400 degrees F for 8-10 minutes - and Blade C is best for that, because the noodles ‘shrink’ up as they cook (because veggies are full of water!) You shouldn’t ever boil butternut squash noodles - they’ll fall apart! 🚫 If you have any other questions about how to cook spiralized veggies, leave them below and we’ll answer them! 👇🏼

Yesterday, we celebrated one of my best friends at her baby shower (she’s having a baby boy in May!) 🤰🏻 I’m so happy for my friend, and I can’t wait for her to experience motherhood. It got me thinking about these past 6 months and how my life has never been better, now that Luca’s in it. 👶🏻💙 While all the crazy sleepless nights in the beginning when I had absolutely no idea what to do (I had only held 1 baby in my entire life!) were exhausting, overwhelming, and seemingly impossible, you always get through it. I always used to be amazed by how far I could push myself physically in fitness (like running a marathon or doing 50 burpees in a row), but nothing compares to the limits that are pushed when you’re a parent (and especially a breastfeeding mother!) 🤱🏻 For all of you future mamas out there, get ready for the most incredible journey of your life - and remember, during the toughest of times in the middle of the night, it’s only a night. It gets SO much better. 🙌🏼 Love these photos taken by @eedwyer last week - Luca’s almost 6 months and this is the best stage so far! He’s got such a personality now! Happy Sunday, loves! ✨

I came home today with full intentions of working out and having a productive night of laundry and organizing, but I was absolutely exhausted and I ended up passing out for two hours. Today certainly ended an era. I spent the afternoon at my childhood home (where I lived my whole life up until college!) and grabbed as much as I could fit in my apartment. It feels surreal to be leaving Bernardsville behind, especially because my family - the Maffuccis - have been in that town for many, many years. My grandparents and parents both went to Bernards High School like me- my grandma actually won "Best Dressed" her senior year! As we were driving out of the driveway, I got a little sentimental and had to snap one last photo in the front yard, a yard I used to sled down with my brother and sister when we were little. Bye bye, Bville- and thanks for the memories! I'm ready for the next chapter ❤️ cc: @felicia_maffucci @kmaffucci

Just a little morning meal prep on Christmas Eve! Totally normal, right?! As the 👶🏻 naps, I just prepped veggies and lentils for veggie bowl lunches for the fam! 🍠🥦🥑🥕 When we go to make lunch, we’ll combine the veggies and lentils, top with sliced avocado and drizzle with tahini! It takes about an hour to prep all of this and it ensures healthy, satisfying lunches for a few days (depending on how many people you’re serving!) ✌🏼 All veggies are seasoned with olive oil, salt and pepper. Then, the cauliflower is seasoned with curry powder, the string beans with soy sauce, and the sweet potatoes and heirloom carrots with paprika. All veggies are roasted at 400 F for 40-50 minutes (as veggies finish, take them out.) And the lentils are cooked with water and a bay leaf! 🌱 Store all your food in glass containers for some environmental friendliness 🙌🏼🙏🏼 And of course, Merry Christmas Eve! 🎄

Made these 5-ingredient Beet and Oat Mini Muffins this morning for the baby and can’t wait to give them to him for breakfast when he wakes up from his nap! 👶🏻 The roasted beets give the muffins a gorgeous color and a slight sweetness that I know Luca’s going to love! 💙 Bonus: they're just as good for adults! I had them for breakfast with globs of almond butter and a sprinkle of hemp seeds (I'm trying to step up my omega-3 game 💪🏼) I’m working on a muffin series on @inspiralizedkids, but for the meantime, if you want to make these, here’s the recipe (makes 3-4 muffins):
//
➕ 3 tablespoons rolled oats
➕ 1 large ripe banana
➕ 2 large eggs
➕ 1 tablespoon ground flaxseed
➕ 1/2 roasted beet
//
Blend all of the ingredients together and pour into mini muffin tins. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-22 minutes or until a toothpick pierced through the center comes out clean. Enjoy immediately (since there's no baking soda/powder they fall after they've rested, so for optimal fluffiness, enjoy right away, but either way, they're delish!)
//

I am running a bunch of errands today and was packing up my tote bag and figured I'd share a few of my favorites- of course, I don't leave without my sunnies (love these ones by @underarmourwomen), my water bottle (thanks to @birchbox for this amazing @mybkr in my wedding color- lavender!), and hand cream. It’s been great being down in Florida ☀️, living with my parents (and my Grandma is visiting too right now!)- free taste testers (and they’re brutally honest!) and no food waste! 👨‍👩‍👧 I made chicken thighs with chimichurri and potatoes that were gobbled up, so I decided to use the leftover chicken and make these bowls with sweet potatoes, brussels sprouts, and avocado 🥑 This may be a new favorite! The secret to the hash? Buy pre-shredded brussels (saves time!) and make sure you chop up your sweet potatoes really small so they cook in a skillet. After you season, put a lid on the pan and let the steam do the work, tossing just occasionally. Top with avocado, serve with your favorite protein and voila! 👩🏻‍🍳 ALSO, I’ve been getting asked a lot about my diet, as it seems to be more animal protein heavy. 🤔 Usually, I eat vegan during the day and my dinners may or may not be with a meat (I still don’t eat red meat/beef - just pork, poultry, and seafood!) Well, I’m eating the way my body tells me it wants to eat. During my pregnancy, I craved more meat and now, exclusively breastfeeding has kept that craving going. I don’t label my diet anymore (the only time I did that was when I was vegan!) and I’ve never felt better or more energized. 🙌🏼 I eat a TON of veggies, legumes, whole grains, and I eat meat when I crave it. I try to avoid dairy, but I don’t exclude it - if I want it, I have it 🙏🏼 Hope this helps some of you trying to find your healthy stride - just do what works best for YOU and your body. Listen 👂🏼

I’m asked all the time, “How do you start a healthy lifestyle?” or “I want to be healthy, but where do I start?” First off, it’s never too late and there’s never a better time to start than right now. Not Monday, not Sunday, not January 1st, but right now. Once you resolve to committing to a life of focusing on your wellness (instead of a certain period of time until a goal, like a number on the scale, is met), it’s less overwhelming - and much more sustainable. 🙏🏼
.
Knowing that you’re going to do your best to be healthy for the rest of your life is easier than a diet with a deadline. It’s easy to have a bad day on a diet and totally give up and takes two steps backwards. But, with a healthy lifestyle, one off day isn’t a big deal in the grand scheme of life -- and guess what, you are going to have bad days.☔️
.
You are going to have days when you eat everything in sight and not a single vegetable. You’re going to have days when you just NEED to eat that whole chocolate bar. Or have a few extra drinks, because you’re out celebrating with friends. However, as long as most days (I like to think of an 80/20 balance) you are nourishing your body and treating it right, you’ll live a happy and healthy balanced lifestyle. ✨
.

Every day, I wake up and set my intentions. I always plan for a productive day, and I’m always optimistic. However, as the hours pass, I sometimes start to lose that initial motivation. A bad e-mail, a disappointment, a failed project, a tech issue - whatever it is, it brings me down. When this happens, I take 5 minutes to myself, put on some upbeat music (I’m loving the new Biebs song), and make a list of the Top 3 things that I MUST accomplish that day - no ifs, ands, or buts. Usually, “exercise” makes the list, but also work-related tasks. After visiting my grandfather in the hospital last night (thanks for all your kind words through Snapchat last night - it meant a lot), and seeing how he’s beating cancer in his mid 80s, I realized that positivity and a determined mindset is all you need. His will to live and his optimism despite such unfortunate circumstances keeps him fighting and keeps the cancer at bay. SO, long story short (this was my 5 minutes with the new Biebs song on, can you tell??), take a minute (or 5) to yourself, set your intentions (again) and resolve to power through this day and make it yours. 👊🏼👊🏼

Every time I walk out the door of our apartment building, I see the downtown NYC skyline and rarely a day goes by that I don't think of 9/11.🇺🇸 Growing up in NJ, 45 minutes outside of NYC, I remember being a freshman in high school and my peers who had parents who worked in the World Trade Centers were frantically trying to get ahold of their families. Everyone remembers where they were on this day, and I'm grateful to live so close to such an incredibly resilient and beautiful city. As I walked to the 9/11 memorial in Jersey City today (I live on the Hudson River directly across from where the WTCs used to stand), I felt courage and strength. With all the hurricane devastation, there's been a lot of unknown and fear, but what I've noticed is that it brings everyone together, like 9/11 did - it's inspiring to see people care for complete strangers and send prayers and acknowledge the fear and pain they are going through. All of you have been so amazing to reach out to me about my parents and brother who now live in Florida (they're OK by the way, thank you!) and today when I walked out my door and saw this, I felt the pride and hope of this country - and that we can get through anything. My thoughts, love and prayers go out to everyone today who lost loved ones on September 11th 🙏🏼💙

To peel or not to peel, that is the question. Many of you ask if you should peel your zucchinis prior to spiralizing. The only reason I ever suggest peeling is if you want less of a crunch or want the noodles to look more like spaghetti aesthetically. Otherwise, ditch the peeler! Many nutrients are in the skin of the zucchini and it makes for a beautiful green presentation. Plus, the firm skin holds up against heavy sauces and keeps some of that moisture tucked away (once you peel it, the inside flesh will start to "sweat" and you'll end up with a soupier-than-normal bowl of noodles.) Any other spiralizing questions? Ask away! 🌀

Whenever I'm asked, "What's your biggest piece of business advice?", my answer is always this: no one is going to do it for you. It seems simple and underwhelming, but it's SO true and often overlooked. But I don't mean it at ALL in a negative way. I mean that it's exciting - thrilling, even - to know that the power is all in your hands. You can literally do anything you want: but you're going to be the one that makes it happen. Tip Tuesday ✍🏼! Since I was off my game last week on account of my Bell’s Palsy recovery, I forgot Tip Tuesday! This week, let's talk about spiralizing BROCCOLI. 🥦🥦🥦 Yes, you can spiralize broccoli! And I recommend it - it has a similar consistency to a carrot noodle once it's boiled and there are so many great vitamins in the stems! Here are a few tips for you and if all else fails, click the link in our profile for more information (and a video 🎥) on how to spiralize broccoli stems!
//
📌 Save up your broccoli stems (they last up to 1 week in the refrigerator for best results!) as you use broccoli florets - never throw them away! At the end of the week, spiralize the stems and use them in a meal or save them in the freezer for future use!
📌 Search for THICK broccoli stems - at least 1.5" in diameter, but the bigger the better 😂😝
📌 Before you spiralize, slice off any knobs off the sides of the broccoli so you don't get shreds and instead, even noodles!
📌 Always use Blade D - Blade D on @theinspiralizer yields the thinnest, spaghetti-like noodles. Any other blade won't be as effective, because broccoli stems aren't thick enough to use other sized blades!
📌 Embrace the wonky noodles - spiralizing broccoli isn't like a zucchini - broccoli bits will break off, pieces will be uneven, but at the end, you get a combo of broccoli slaw and noodles - and once they're cooked up, they're delicious, so don't strive for perfect noodles! //
Those are my tips - so tell me, have you spiralized broccoli yet? Any questions? Or something you need help with for next week's Tip?!

My favorite (non-spiralized) way to prepare sweet potatoes: 🍠 slice into wedges or slices and season with olive oil, salt, pepper, and a few pinches of chili powder. Roast in the oven at 425 degrees Fahrenheit for 25-35 minutes, flipping the sweet potatoes halfway through. Careful not to crowd the sweet potato pieces so they crisp up around the edges nicely! And that’s it 👌🏼

I love starting Fridays off with a quote. ✨ I used to look at the weekends as a way to just totally disconnect from my goals from the week and just “let loose.” Now, I go through the weekend with the same conviction as I had on Monday. If you need a “day off” why can’t that be on a Tuesday? or a Thursday? The weekends aren’t a time to ruin everything you worked so hard on since Monday to build. I’ve always loved this quote, because it’s a good reminder to take each day on its own - no purpose in counting down or looking too far ahead. 🙏🏼 Everything you need to focus on takes place today. CRUSH YOUR FRIDAY, loves! 🙌🏼👊🏼

I’m excited to share my personal weight loss and fit journey story on the blog today AND launching the second round of my Spiralized Meal Plans (link in profile to read 👆🏼) I’ve never felt so confident with my body in my entire life, and it’s all thanks to FINALLY committing to a healthy lifestyle. 💕 No more fad diets, no more resets, no more detoxes, no more goal dates for weight loss. I started spiralizing for most lunches and all dinners for about 3 months and was able to shed 30 pounds, along with consistent exercise (documented on @getinspiralized). In the blog post, I’m sharing sample weekly meal plans and fitness routines, and providing plenty of real-life inspo with my before and after photos. I’m sharing the mantras that guided me through my journey (like realizing that once I stopped looking at exercise as a means to lose weight, I finally lost the weight.) I hope this inspires and motivates those who were in a similar position as I was, and I encourage you to start spiralizing every day! And, after reading the post, if anyone has any questions, leave them here in the comments or on the blog, and I’ll be answering them! Just remember this: everyone has to start at some point, so just start today - don’t wait until January 1 or 2, start now, because there are no dates or timeline on a healthy lifestyle, it’s forever! Love you all, thank you for all your kindness and positivity over my personal fit journey, you’ve kept me going! 🏋🏻‍♀️

If you’re looking for easy breakfasts to prep for the week or cute brunch ideas this weekend, pack in some spiralized veggies into muffin tins and pour in eggs. Picked up zucchini (duh!), tomatoes, potatoes, bell peppers, garlic, and onions this Saturday at the farmer's market in anticipation of making this meal. 😍 It takes a grand total of 30 minutes once the oven is preheated! Cooked the veggies with olive oil, Italian seasoning, red pepper flakes, garlic, veggie broth, salt and pepper and stirred in cooked quinoa once the veggies were very soft. Served the mixture alongside roasted potatoes (seasoned with garlic powder) with roasted wild caught salmon seasoned with salt, pepper and a little Old Bay (random, but trust me!) This has become one of our go-to summer meals 🙌🏼☀️ And I will definitely be making and freezing this quinoa mixture for when the baby arrives 👶🏻

Happy hump day, loves! 💚💛 Today on the blog I’m talking all about spreading love - with care packages! You know... those boxes your parents may have sent you while you were at college? Or maybe the box of cupcakes your co-worker brought to work on your birthday? Whatever it was - didn’t it make you feel so loved and thought of? Today, I’m sharing a super easy way to spread the love to someone who needs an extra boost. You probably have all the ingredients in your pantry and refrigerator already - granola (I used @bobsredmill), milk (I used almond milk), and fruit (I used blueberries and peaches)! 🍑 Read more about this simple but thoughtful way to reach out to someone on the blog - link in profile 👆🏼

UGH, I love this quote SO SO much! 💯✍🏼 SERIOUSLY. Don’t be afraid of the time it may take you to accomplish your goals/dreams. As Earl Nightingale says, the time’s going to pass anyway! What helps me in staying on track with my goals (both personal and professional) is to think about that gap of time. How do I want to spend that gap of time? NOT working towards a goal or working towards it? Sure, it may take me 5, 10, 15 years to achieve my dreams for Inspiralized, but what’s the alternative? Giving up, just because that length of time intimidates me? No way! The same applies for health and fitness - it may take you 3 months to lose those extra pounds, define a muscle group, or train for that race, but if you don’t give up and keep on track, those 3 months will be here in no time (and, yes, that time is going to pass anyway!) See where I’m taking this? Embrace the journey, or as @robinnyc would say, MARINATE in it. The hustle is the most rewarding part of all! Happy Friday, everyone - now go take a step towards your dreams & goals! 👊🏼✨

“Visible mess helps distract us from the true source of the disorder. The act of cluttering is really an instinctive reflex that draws our attention away from the heart of an issue.” I’m reading Marie Kondo’s “The Life-changing Magic of Tidying Up” and I couldn’t feel more inspired. I’m so excited to literally tidy up this weekend. And since I’ve started decorating my apartment, I feel much more composed and organized in my new digs. I feel inspired to create in a clean, focused way! Can’t wait to finish up the book... has anyone else read it?!

It’s great to have goals. It’s healthy! I have so many goals, and I’m constantly working towards them. 👊🏼However, it can be easy to get caught up in the hustle and the pursuit of something and as a result, forget the things, people, and the life you have. Take a moment today - or this weekend - and just be grateful for the life you have, no matter how tough that may seem to do in the moment. Practice some self-care and also appreciate the ones around you. 💕 Whatever you do, remember that while goals are exciting, they come and go - the journey is what counts the most (and where you live most of your life!) 🙏🏼 Happy Thursday, everyone!

GIVEAWAY HAS ENDED! Congratulations to @rise.n.dine @rach_est @gdemarco9 - For our fifth and final giveaway of this week, I'm partnering up with @bobsredmill to give THREE winners a package of my favorite, most-used Bob's products (Quinoa, Lentils, Almond Flour, Coconut Flour, and Old Fashioned Oats) AND sharing my No-Bake Lactation/Energy Bites (which use @bobsredmill's Old Fashioned Rolled Oats). 🤱🏻💪🏼 These bites are not just for nursing mamas - consider them energy bites that also may help with boosting lactation for those women who are nursing. Otherwise, they're just energy bites that regulate blood sugar levels (thanks to the Brewer's Yeast), are packed with protein (thanks to the nut butter), omega-3s (thanks to the flaxseed), fiber and antioxidants (thanks to the oats) and and are just sweet enough (thanks to the honey and vanilla)! 👌🏼 They're seriously addicting - and I love having them on hand just as an energy boost! This recipe uses @bobsredmill Flaxseed Meal and Old-Fashioned Rolled Oats. To enter to win the giveaway, you must "LIKE" this photo, be following @inspiralized and @bobsredmill AND tag at least one friend in the comments below! Open to US and Canada addresses only and the winner will be announced tomorrow! And to bookmark this recipe, you can save it to your Instagram feed by clicking the little tag icon OR you can find it today on the @alissandrab blog! +
No-Bake Lactation/Energy Bites
+
Makes 24 bites
+
Ingredients
+
2.25 cups old-fashioned oats
½ cup ground flaxseed
3 tablespoons brewer’s yeast
1 cup peanut butter or almond butter
½ cup honey
1 teaspoon vanilla
+
Directions
+
In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, add all ingredients. Mix on low speed until mixture is well combined and can easily be formed into smooth balls.
+
Roll mixture into 2-tablespoon sized smooth balls and place on a parchment-lined baking sheet. Place in the refrigerator for 30 minutes or enjoy right away. Once the bites have set, transfer them to an air-tight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
+

Happy Tuesday, loves! 👯Whatever you do today, make sure you’re doing it for you. Put yourself first. If there’s anything I’ve learned through my business and my personal relationships, if you’re not happy with yourself and who you are/what you do, then you’ll never be able to love and help others around you. It can be so easy to get caught up in the comparison game and start acting a certain way just to get likes, people-please, or to fit in. FORGET THAT. 💁🏻Today, do something for YOU just because you’re doin’ you. ✌🏼Stand up for yourself. Take a lunch break alone and don’t feel sorry about it! Reserve a spot in that workout class you’ve been dying to try, even if you’ll be late to plans with friends. Make the dinner YOU want tonight, not the dinner your roomie/partner wants. They’ll deal 🙏🏼

Sometimes I make fancy breakfasts - spiralized frittatas with avocado 🥑 or açaí bowls loaded with superfood toppings or two-ingredient pancakes with collagen 🥞 and an almond butter drizzle. But mostly, my breakfasts look like this - oatmeal with almond butter and blueberries with a side of scrambled eggs. 🍳 Not exactly “Instagram-worthy”, but I wanted to show you what I actually eat on a regular basis - not the prettiest, but definitely satisfying, healthy, and easy! I hate the pressure Instagram puts on you to always post “the best” - whether it’s your best angle or your best meal. So today, I’m not worrying about putting up something gorgeous - just a real breakfast! ☕️✌🏼

Good morning!! ☕️☀️ One more day until the weeeekenddd 🙌🏼 I’ve been making these on-the-go smoothie bowls lately which are basically just a smoothie in a cup with smoothie bowl toppings, with a spoon to scrape it all up! They’re easier to eat at your desk, can be put in a to-go cup, and have a crunchier, more exciting consistency than your average smoothie! I made this one on IG stories this morning, but it has 1 banana, 2/3 cup packed @cascadianfarm organic frozen kale, 1 handful @earthboundfarm frozen blueberries, 2 scoops of @vitalproteins marine collagen, 1 tablespoon @justins peanut butter, ice and almond milk. Topped with @bobsredmill granola and chia seeds! Now, I'm ready to conquer this day full of back-to-back calls and meetings 💪🏼

I receive emails almost everyday with people asking me to help them on their health journeys. They frequently ask, “What did you eat to lose weight?” (PS: if you didn’t already know, I lost 30 pounds about a year ago and have since kept it off, +/- 5 pounds) It’s so tough to answer this question adequately. I didn’t set out to “lose 30 pounds”, I decided once and for all that I’d commit to a healthy lifestyle forever. That means no more calorie counting, no more compulsive exercising (i.e. 2 a days) and no more feeling shameful or guilty over food. I started simply eating clean, wholesome, REAL foods. That’s it! No more "cheat days", just days where I eat something "unhealthy" because a) I love food and b) it brings me happiness. Now, whenever I have a weekend where I over-indulge (MDW was full of 🍕, 🍸and 🍪), I don’t “detox” or do anything crazy like that. I simply focus on eating well again. Today’s lunch is a kale bowl with quinoa, chickpeas, avocado, and roasted carrots and asparagus. Oh and a sh*t ton of water! If you’re interested more in my journey, click the link in my profile. Also, if you have any questions at all, I’m in the midst of writing more about my journey - so ask me anything and I’ll include it in the upcoming post! 📝

We often overthink the START, when it’s easy as... STARTING! 💡Whether it’s committing to a healthy diet or building a side hustle business, don’t get caught up in all the details - when, how, what if. Just start! ✨ All the rest will fall into place once you’re on your way. I get asked a lot, “What can I do to start a healthy lifestyle?” I always respond with, “Just start eating healthy!” It’s as simple as that - instead of setting a date (ugh, don’t say Monday!) just start right then and there in that moment. Maybe you’re going away for the weekend - that’s okay, make as many healthy decisions as you can that weekend. Just start! Stop pushing off your goals and dreams - just go for them. 🙌🏼 It’s much easier than you think and once you view it that way, you’ll be amazed at what you can accomplish. 🙏🏼 Happy Friday, everyone! I’m feeling extra motivated today (I think it’s the extra hour I let myself sleep in today) and can’t wait to conquer this day and start the weekend 💪🏼

With Easter coming up this weekend (it actually lands on my BIRTHDAY🎂 - any April Fool’s babies out there?!), I figured you could use a healthy, spiralized spring frittata recipe BUT this recipe isn't posting on the blog for a few weeks, so I'm sharing it with my Instagram fam early! Hope you love this Spiralized Carrot and Leek Frittata with Feta (🧀 is always optional!) //
Spiralized Carrot and Leek Frittata with Feta 🥕🍳
//
Serves: 4
//
Ingredients
1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil
1/2 cup sliced leeks (about 1.5 leeks)
1 large carrot, Blade D with @theinspiralizer, noodles trimmed
salt and pepper
1 garlic clove, minced
8 large eggs
1/4 cup crumbled feta or goat cheese (optional)
//
Directions
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Heat the oil in a 10" oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Once oil is shimmering, add the leeks and carrots and season with salt and pepper. Cook or 5 minutes or until carrot noodles are mostly wilted. Sprinkle with garlic and toss until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Pour over the eggs and top with feta. Let cook for 2 minutes or until the bottom sets and then transfer to the oven for 8-12 minutes or until eggs are set. Remove, slice into 4 pieces and serve.
//
Hope you enjoy it, friends!

When I first began vegan with one of my best friends (holla @saralalala) back in the summer of 2008, my world turned upside down: everything felt like it was off limits (which is ironic, because veganism opened up my eyes to so many different foods and ingredients I had never tried.) I had to teach myself to cook right away and the first dish I truly learned to make that senior year was a tofu and veggie teriyaki stir fry over brown rice. I must've made it 100 times (and @cass6127 my roommate and college bestie can confirm that.) Now, I'm no longer vegan, but I still incorporate vegan principles into my cooking, with slight modifications to fit my current lifestyle. Tonight, I scrambled in eggs to turn the brown rice into a fried rice for extra protein and flavor. Still to this day, I love this dish and am so thankful for my two years as a vegan. I learned how to really love veggies, cook to nourish, not be afraid of carbs, eat much less meat, and be kinder to my body. ❤️🌱

Tip Tuesday (err, Friday!) ✍🏼! Another week, I forgot to post my Tuesday tip, so it's Tip Friday! FRIYAY, guys. FRIYAY. Today we're talking about HOW TO AVOID SOGGY NOODLES. Now, this really is only an issue with zucchini noodles (because they're made up of over 90% water.) While excess moisture is inevitable, you shouldn't be left with soggy noodles every time you cook your zucchini! Here are a few tips on how to avoid a bowl of soupy zoodles and for more info, click the link in our profile for a video on the topic!
//
➕ After you spiralize the zucchini, moisture comes out because the skin is removed (@theinspiralizer peels as it spiralizes!), so pat your noodles dry after spiralizing to get rid of some moisture.
➕ If you're making a sauce, make sure to reduce it fully - watery sauces will turn into really watery sauces, once the zucchini cooks and releases that extra moisture.
➕ Keep the skin on your zucchini - not only does the skin contain essential nutrients, it gives the noodle that needed crunch, helping to avoid a soggy texture.
➕ You can definitely salt your zucchini and wait for the moisture to drip off OR squeeze your zoodles in a cheesecloth to rid of excess moisture BUT this will leave you with soggy noodles (once the moisture leaves the zucchini, they're limp noodles!) I don't recommend this method, it's time consuming and doesn't get you very far.
➕ Add moisture-wicking ingredients, like cheese, meats, breadcrumbs, and other veggies that are not high in moisture.
➕ Don't add your noodles into a sauce - always cook the sauce and then top your noodles with the sauce.
➕ Never dump your cooked noodles into a bowl - remove them with pasta tongs, letting any water drip out before you place them in your serving bowl.
➕ After you cook your noodles, drain them into a colander and pat dry before serving. ➕ Eat immediately! The longer the noodles sit in the sauce, the more time the noodles have for their moisture to release. So, eat up!
//
Those are this week's tips! Let me know if you need help with something for next week's Tip!

Shared this quote on Facebook the there day and over at @getinspiralized. ✨It’s always been one of my favorites: The comeback is always stronger than the setback. Whether you’re talking about your health or your work, it’s just SO true. Setbacks are just setups for comebacks - and they’re always stronger. 💪🏼 Just know that if, for instance, you’ve been eating poorly and not sticking to your fitness goals, it’s okay - just focus on your comeback, it’s going to be better than any setback. Nothing feels better than getting back on track and getting close to your goals! 👊🏼🏋🏻‍♀️💃🏻Here’s to crushing our goals and focusing on comebacks and saying “buh bye!” to our setbacks. 👋🏼

To properly prep a butternut squash for spiraliIng, you need to cut off the bulbous, seeded bottom and then peel the neck, which is the part of the squash that you'll be spiralizing. But what about that bottom? Scoop out the seeds and roast it and stuff it with quinoa, farro, or even ground meat for a healthy dinner! Or, you can chop it up into cubes, roast it and save it for snacking, tossing in salads or pastas. Keep this in mind next time you spiralized a butternut squash and there will be no waste leftover and you'll get two types of meals out of one squash! 👊🏻

Not exactly the photo I imagined on my 31st birthday, but I’ll take it. Last year, on my 30th, I announced our pregnancy. This year, I don’t have anything nearly as exciting to reveal, but I do have a healthy, happy, and handsome 6-month old (seen here sucking on an 🍎 earlier today at my birthday brunch at @restaurant_marc_forgione) and a loving husband who always knows how to make me laugh, even in the least funny of times, like now, with my Bell’s Palsy diagnosis. If you haven’t been watching my stories, I woke up with this condition on Wednesday, which renders half your face completely paralyzed. Thank you for everyone who has sent me a happy birthday message and made me feel special and loved, it’s especially meaningful this year, when I don’t feel like my same cheery self right now. But let me tell you, it puts a lot into perspective (more on that soon) and I’m grateful to be able to celebrate the start of what I hope ends up being an even better year (it can really only go up from here 😂🤣)! And for the record, I’m smiling as big and hard as I can in this photo 🙈 🎂😘💙

I typed and deleted this post at least three times, but I figured my weight loss and fit journey story may inspire someone to take control like I did and found my healthy way. The picture on the left is from July 2013, a few weeks after I started Inspiralized. The picture on the right is from my honeymoon (June 2015). What happened in between? I started a lifestyle. I decided that I wouldn't yo-yo anymore and I'd find something that worked for my specific body and I did. I discovered that mainly eating real, whole foods is the most liberating decision you may make in your life. I realized this after I discovered the spiralizer, which made me realize how delicious vegetables can really be. In the before picture, I was binge eating and unhappy and in the after picture (about 35 pounds lighter), I was enjoying everything, just in moderation. I hope that some of you discover what I discovered after getting

REAL TALK time 🙏🏼 Good morning and happy Friday, loves! I don’t know if this baby is having a last-minute growth spurt or something, but last night I couldn’t stop eating! I don’t share enough about the days when I don’t eat my healthiest, so I figured I’d share! And yes, I’m pregnant, but being pregnant doesn’t mean you can just eat whatever and however much you like - quite the contrary, it’s even more important to eat well to nourish that baby inside you! 👶🏻 And things like sugar affect the baby just like they affect us! Anyway, I literally ate a box of @simplemills chocolate chip cookies 🍪🍪 (they’re dangerously good!), a bag of @squareorganics new protein sea salt popcorn (also insanely good - it almost tastes cheesy, it’s addictive!), globs of almond butter and dates, two mugs of @naturespathorganic cereal with almond milk, a couple of @lundbergarms rice cakes, and an @alohamoment protein bar. This was all on TOP of dinner of course. 🤦🏻‍♀️ NOW, I don’t keep anything “unhealthy” or super processed in the apartment, so at least I wasn’t eating rolls of Oreos, BUT that’s still a lot of food for one night! There’s always a reason behind eating like this, and for me, it was hydration - I was out for most of the day and didn’t drink much water, so my body was dehydrated. 💦 Instead of filling up my big water bottle like I always do at night, I started munching - and once the munching begins, it’s hard to stop! So how am I recovering today? No detoxing, no green juicing for the day, no skipping meals. 🚫Simply, I’m starting the day off with a big spinach collagen smoothie topped with chia seeds, coconut flakes, and @purely_elizabeth granola and drinking TONS of water. 🌱 I’m going to try to fit in a workout at some point and make smart choices all day! 👌🏼Anyway, hope this resonates with some of you who struggle with having those bad nights - don’t let yourself feel guilty in the morning, the next day is a NEW day and there’s no point spending time in the past, there’s nothing you can change about that - but you can change the present and make healthy decisions! 👊🏼 💙

I’m not sure when I stumbled upon this inspirational message, but it changed the way I approached fitness. I was totally that girl who used to dread workouts but say, “Ugh, I have to - I ate so many 🍩🍫🍦🍷🍕🍟 last night!” I would try to “out run” a poor diet (news flash: you can’t!) While I’ll still amp up a workout if I’ve indulged a bit more than expected, I don’t look at workouts as a way to combat my diet. My workouts and my diet work in tandem to create a happy, healthy me! Now, as I train for my half marathon in October (see sweaty selfies over at @getinspiralized), I’m amazed by my body and what it can do. I want to eat well not to look a certain way, but to fuel my body for my runs so that I can push farther and harder. Whether it’s a 4 mile run or an 8 mile run, I’m so thankful for my legs and as @robinnyc always says in her spin classes, “Do it because you CAN.” Who else can relate to this quote? It’s simple, but can be absolutely transformative if you truly adopt it! 💪🏻

Just me and Luca, living our best lives earlier tonight 👩‍👦 I love this 4 month old with every ounce of my being. 👶🏻 He has stolen my heart, and I can’t even remember life before him. 💙 He makes me laugh and smile and remember what’s most important in life: our families. Yes, this book is an A-to-Z (apples to zucchini) guide to spiralizing and basically, an encyclopedia to spiralizing! I've included new tips, tricks, and methods for spiralizing, along with 100% new recipes (that's right - none of the recipes in this book have been on the blog yet!) The book is organized alphabetically by vegetable. So, if you have a zucchini, you can go straight to the Zucchini chapter and see what recipes you can make with your zucchini. This book is totally user-friendly and meant to make the most of your spiralizing experience! What do you think of this style? Get your spiralizers ready.

A lot of you write to me and ask me how do I get my husband to eat healthy with me. Some of you get frustrated when your bae doesn't want to eat spiralized food. Well, I'm a very lucky lady because Lu likes spiralized food more than ME (well, almost 😉). BUT having said that, I definitely do a few things to make the meal more "manly" each time. For instance, take tonight's dinner: turkey meatballs with zucchini noodles and multigrain bread: 1) Give him an extra slice or two of bread, 2) Give him about 1/2 zucchini extra when spiralizing, 3) Give him an extra meatball, and 4) Top his with Parmesan! Those little tweaks can satisfy the boo, while letting yourself eat a bit cleaner. ✌🏻️

My favorite way to cook fresh summer corn (and Jersey has the BEST corn 😜) is to shave the kernels off with a knife and then cook them raw in a skillet with olive oil, salt, and paprika or chili powder! They cook quickly - only takes about 5 minutes and they come out perfectly charred, flavorful, and fork tender. Have you tried this method? Props to @theisaacjames for capturing the process during my recipe photoshoot with @pelotoncycle! 🌽🌽🌽

@gigihadid nailed it with this quote 🍔 Balance is what it’s all about. If there’s anything I’ve learned in my own personal health journey, over-restricting and labeling your diet is the worst thing you can do for your sanity. Unless you have allergies, auto-immune issues, or strong ethical reasons, completely eliminating entire food groups from your diet often isn’t sustainable and leads to unhealthy behaviors and obsessions with food. Of course, that’s not ALWAYS the case - there are plenty of very happy and healthy eaters out there who restrict major food groups (i.e. vegans, vegetarians) and they thrive! 🙌🏼However, for those that can’t commit to such a restrictive lifestyle but want to live their healthiest, know that moderation IS possible, I’m living proof of it! Having a 🍪 or 🍦 every once in a while won’t shave years off your life - and especially when enjoyed with friends or a loved one, they can release happy endorphins which are much more valuable than that maca you’re sprinkling in your smoothie. ✌🏼 Living without the stress of perfection of an “Oh, that’s not healthy, I don’t eat that” mentality is liberating and ironically leads to a healthier relationship with food - and your body. On that note, today on the blog, I’m talking about the

In serious tourist mode: sneakers, sports bra, a tee & jorts. ☺️ Today was a full, amazing day. We started with an incredible breakfast featuring spicy fried eggs and noodles and then head into the city for a proper Thai massage that ended with the most delicious cashew-rice cracker and hibiscus tea. Walked around the Wat Chedi Luang temple and came back to have lunch at the hotel, stuffing ourselves with sticky rice, spicy seafood stir fry, and Thai BBQ chicken. Regrouped and then headed to a temple up in the mountains: Wat Prathat Doi Suthep, where this picture was taken. What a gorgeously detailed temple and what breathtaking views of Chiang Mai. Such a humbling experience to see such culture and history. We're now on our way to the Sunday night markets, where I'm excited to try all the street foods. Having the best time, this place is truly magical 🙌🏻

All summer long, I've been telling myself to take 30 minutes to myself and sit outside, have lunch, and breath in the fresh air. I always feel bad taking "breaks”, even though I know they're good for my focus and relaxation. Well, for the first time this summer, I did it! I laced up my @geox Nebula shoes, put on my favorite boyfriend jeans, and went downstairs, hit up the salad bar, and then sat outside to enjoy it. And guess what? It absolutely refreshed me! It's silly how much pressure we put on ourselves to always be hustling nonstop! If we don't take care of ourselves, we won't be able to achieve everything we want in life! Cheers to making more of an effort to nourish our mind, body and soul 🙌🏻

Whenever I would complain to my mother that something was unfair, she used to always tell me, “Don’t compare yourself to anyone else.” Perhaps it was jealousy towards a friend who took a cool vacation with their family or even just a sibling who got to stay up later, she encouraged me to always focus on myself and not be sidetracked, influenced, discouraged, or competitive with others. It wasn’t until the past couple of years with @inspiralized and being on social media did I realize that she had such a profound impact on how I go about my life. I don’t compare myself with others, I’m happy for the success of those around me, and I’m not discouraged, only motivated and inspired by those who are doing big things. They’re not “better” things, they’re just “big” things. If you find yourself saying things like, “I’ll never be as [insert jealous adjective here] as her!” or “I wish my business was as successful as theirs!”, stop yourself and just realize that, especially on social media, people tend to promote only the highlights and the good, not the struggle or the hardships. So never compare yourself to others, because you don’t know what’s truly happening in their “behind the scenes.” I always try to put positive, healthy inspiration on this Instagram channel (and all my channels for that matter) not because I want to create this fake, happy life, but because I want a place for people to come to be inspired. I try to hint at the struggles (aka my almond butter binge confessions on @getinspiralized), but in case it isn’t clear: I struggle. I get discouraged. I feel like I’m never doing enough or that my company isn’t where it needs to be. I often think I’m being lazy or not achieving my potential. Life is real, and the struggle is real. Keep your chin up, put one foot in front of the other, and keep pushing forward, because at the end of the day, that’s all you CAN do. And it’ll pay off in the end. And as for comparing yourself to others: just don’t do it. Remember: there’s NO ONE in this world who can be you. You’re you - and THAT’S what makes you special. So be you. Do you. ❤️ you all.

Never, ever compare yourself to others - especially on the Internet❗️It's easy to get caught up in the comparison game and as someone trying to build a business, it can be an easy trap to fall in, which I definitely fell into in the very beginning. You may see someone who "seems" to be doing better than you, taking more exciting trips than you, reaching their health goals quicker than you, or getting more opportunities than you, but just remember: things are not always as they seem, especially with success. 🥕Whatever you do, keep doing you, keep focused on your goals, and keep moving forward. That's ALL that matters 👊🏼Tag a friend who may need some motivation this week! 😘

Our little baby boy is 3 weeks old today! 👶🏻 At the beginning, my sister in law told me that the days would be long but the weeks would go fast and she was SO right! We’ve been taking each day at a time, learning so much about our son (and babies, in general), and snuggling as much as possible. 💙 I’ve loved watching Lu with Luca, it melts my heart seeing him playing with him when he’s up and alert and trying to soothe him when he’s fussy at night. Lu and I have found our groove together as parents and it’s been fun sharing the laughs, cuddles, and worries together. We had our first sleepless night on Saturday and all of you helped so much with your advice/suggestions/tips, it makes me even MORE grateful to have this community. 🙏🏼 Luca will cry so hard he’ll turn purple (like when we’re changing him - he hates it!) and other times, like when I’m nursing him, he’ll look up at me, totally content, with his big beautiful eyes and I realize that I love this little boy more than I could ever have imagined. Loving life as Mommy and our little family 👪 Thanks for all the love you’ve been sending my way!

One month from now, think about where you want to be. January 1st is a time when the majority of us set health goals - weight loss, muscle-building, etc. What most people do leading up to the New Year is “get it all in” before their diets start. It’s more shocking and thus, less sustainable if you look at it that way. Instead of waiting until the New Year to start working towards your healthiest self, why not start on December 1st? It’s the holiday season, so it’s going to be tough - but make little choices each day that help you get closer to your goals, so that when January 1st comes around, you’ll look back at today and thank yourself for starting the shift earlier. It’s a hustle, after all - it’s a hustle to keep healthy, especially around this time of year when the temptation comes in the shape of champagne, cocktail parties, Christmas cookies, and festive excuses. And it’s okay, it IS a hustle - there will be ups and downs. But promise yourself today to not let yourself go for the next 31 days. You won’t feel good during this joyful time of year if you’re bloated, lethargic, and unhappy with yourself. Promise yourself that you’re committing to a lifestyle- the calendar date doesn’t mean anything. Sip that egg nog and enjoy that sugar cookie, but make it to the gym, focus on eating clean the rest of the time, get enough sleep, and come January 1, you won’t feel overwhelmed - you’ll be closer to your goals and will have trained yourself to live a healthy lifestyle, not a diet that starts on a certain day. If you’re with me, comment on this photo - and on January 1, I’ll be following up with all of you! Let’s hold each other accountable. 💪🏼

LOTS to talk about. 🙏🏼 On the blog today, I'm talking all about how to travel and stay on your healthy track - AND how to recover post-vacation/travel trip. 👌🏼 FINALLY, I'm sharing my go-to green protein smoothie recipe. OH! And we're hosting a giveaway 🎉 (see details below 👇🏼) If you don't want to click through to the blog (link in profile for the full post), here's the recipe:
------------------------------------
GREEN PROTEIN SMOOTHIE 🌱
- 1 medium frozen banana
- 1/4 cup frozen blueberries (or a large handful) - 2-2.5 packed cups of spinach or kale
- 1 tablespoon almond butter or peanut butter
- 1 scoop of @alohamoment Vanilla Protein Powder - 1/4 - 1/3 cup of unsweetened almond milk (enough to reach a smoothie consistency) - For topping: raspberries, granola, chia seeds, toasted coconut flakes
------------------------------------
In a high speed blender, combine the banana, blueberries, spinach, nut butter, protein powder, and almond milk and blend until smooth. Pour the smoothie into a bowl and top with desired toppings. I love raspberries, granola, chia seeds, and toasted coconut flakes. Serve!
-------------------------------------

One of the most common questions I get asked about my health journey is, "How do you survive the weekends?!" Well, I enjoy them. I'm not good at moderation, so the only way I can eat the portions I want to while staying healthy is by ordering as vegan as possible. After searching through old Facebook photos for an upcoming blog post, I wanted to share another before and after, this time with Lu in it! Although he’s always loved my body from day 1 (and never stops telling me that), I felt much more confident when he held me on the right (my “after” picture) around my waist. I’m only 5-7 more pounds than my honeymoon weight now (but a little more muscular!) and I’m proud to say that I’ve maintained this healthy weight for over a year. I’m excited to turn 29 on Friday (yes, I’m an April Fool’s baby!) and finally have found happiness with my body and can’t wait to see what my 29th year brings. And I’ll be talking more about what I want to accomplish in that year once @alissandrab re-launches on Friday! Did you know that you can turn your spiralized veggies into rice? 👋🏼Well, you can! How? Just pack your spiralized noodles into a food processor and pulse until rice-like! Then, you can use that spiralized rice to make healthy rice dishes, like Sweet Potato Fried Rice or one of my favorites, my Arroz con Pollo (using golden beet rice!) In this video, you’ll see three types - turnip, sweet potato, and beet BUT you can use all spiralized veggies as rice (even zucchini!) except for cucumber - it just turns to mush. For more information, click the link in our profile 👆🏼

The busy girl’s guide to smoothies: @dailyharvest. 🏃🏻‍♀️Seriously, these smoothies are the BEST. On days when I just want a grab-and-go breakfast situation, I grab a Daily Harvest smoothie from the freezer, add almond milk, my @vitalproteins collagen and pour the smoothie back into the container, top with some granola, put the lid back on and go! 🙌🏼 My favorite flavor is this one, the Carrot + Chia GLOW, made with banana, carrot, dates, walnut, sweet potato, ginger, chia, vanilla bean, nutmeg and cinnamon. Spiralizer hack time! You may never have thought to do this: stuff some spiralized cucumber ribbons into a large square ice cube tray, pour over with water, and freeze for your own Cucumber Ice Cubes! 🥒 These ice cubes are great to rub under your eyes after a late night to help with any puffiness OR toss them into your water for a nice detoxing cucumber water! However you use them, they're easy to make and a fun way to use your @theinspiralizer! Link in profile for more info ☝️

Something about being pregnant has made me feel so grateful for each and every day. Maybe it’s the hormones? 🤷🏻‍♀️ Regardless, it has made me more motivated than ever in all aspects of my life - to be a better friend, a better daughter, sister, wife, boss, and above all, be a great mother. ✨ Each day should be another opportunity for you to work towards your goals and to better yourself - whether that’s getting a promotion at work, losing that last 5 pounds, or starting your business. When I was on my own health journey, what finally made me able to get the body and confidence I wanted was treating every single day as “day one” and turning it into a lifestyle. Don’t let another day go by without making strides for your own happiness and turning those dreams into a reality! Years ago, I used to get so discouraged when I’d see others around me achieving so much and I wanted to know how they did it - and now I know. Every single day can take you one step closer if you make it count! 👊🏼 What will you do today to treat today as “DAY ONE” instead of just ONE DAY? Tell me about your own goals, I want to hear them! ✍🏼 And tag a friend who may need some inspiration! 🙏🏼

Not sure where I first saw this graphic, but I immediately saved it to my phone and made it my lock screen so I'd see it everyday. Let me tell you, just seeing the words "love your body" consistently helped me look at myself more gently. We can all be so critical of our bodies and the first step in being less critical is to think positively. I recently read a comment on the blog asking how to spiralize bell peppers, so I figured I'd share the answer with everyone! You CAN spiralize bell peppers, but they really slice them, instead of making noodles. If you want to spiralize a bell pepper, snap the stem off and secure that end to the teeth of the handle. The other end goes on the central coring blade. Use Blade A and spiralize! Use @theinspiralizer of course!! ✌️ Video coming soon!

Many of you asked me for the recipe for the lentil soup my mother made for us over the weekend - so here it is! She actually adapted @thekitchn's "Fridge Clearing Lentil Soup"! And it's a big batch, so we've been enjoying it all week - just had a big bowl for lunch on this chilly, windy day and feeling cozy. ❄️🤗
+
Ingredients
+
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 large onion, chopped
5 cloves garlic, peeled and chopped
1 teaspoon ground cumin
1/2 teaspoon ground tumeric
Coarse salt and freshly ground pepper
1/2-inch to 1-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and minced
1/2 teaspoon dried red pepper flakes
2 bay leaves
2 cups dried green lentils, picked over and rinsed
4 to 6 cups vegetable stock or water
1 (28-ounce) can crushed tomatoes
1 cup chopped carrots
1 cup chopped celery
2 cups chopped zucchini
+
Directions
+
In a large soup pot (6-quart or larger), heat the olive oil over medium heat and sauté the onion 1 to 2 minutes until softened, then add the garlic, cumin and turmeric. Stir to coat. Add a teaspoon or so of salt and a few cranks of pepper. Add the ginger, red pepper flakes, bay leaves, and lentils. Pour over enough stock to cover. Raise the heat to bring to a boil, then lower to medium-low heat, cover the pot, and simmer.
+
After 15 minutes, add the chopped vegetables (carrots, celery, zucchini.)
+
Cook a total of 30 to 40 minutes, checking every 10 minutes to stir the pot. Soup is done when lentils and vegetables are tender, but not falling apart. If soup needs more liquid at any time, stir in a cup or two. (It should look like thick soup, but not like thick chili.) Pull out the bay leaves and discard. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 7 days.
+

For day 3 of the

The past few days have been incredibly sad and difficult. My grandmother passed away on Tuesday late morning. She was my mother’s mother and our neighbor growing up. She wasn’t just that grandparent you see on holidays. She was the kind of grandma that taught me to read, that came over for saltines and tuna salad snacks after school, took me to the theater in NYC, and took me on trips to Europe, to see and experience the world. This past year has been very hard, as she developed dementia and hasn’t been mentally with us for a while. While she may not have been aware recently, I always had her in my heart, especially when I walked down the aisle to marry my husband. Now, I know she’s watching from wherever she is, proud of the woman I am. I haven’t been as active on social media as I normally have (on Snapchat especially) because it feels uncomfortable to smile or laugh. I haven’t put myself on camera, because it’s hard to be my usual happy, bright self. I’ve read all of your sweet notes on my last post on @alissandrab, as well as on Snapchat, and you have no idea how much it means to me. Today, Meaghan’s here with me and we put up this frame on the wall in the office. Although I bought this print weeks ago, it now proves even more true: I’ve cried, I worked out yesterday with my sister to try to shake the sadness, and tomorrow, I leave for Florida (with my sister) to spend time with my mom, by the sea. Time heals everything and in these times, you realize what’s truly important. Thank you to everyone for your kindness in advance, and I appreciate your patience as I take a little time to get back into the swing of things. ❤️

This morning I typed up Sunday's post which is going to talk about my latest discovery in my fit journey and my life as a 28 (soon to be 29 😳) year old woman and finally finding peace with my body. The discovery is this: your healthiest and happiest weight may not be your lowest weight. After all, what's a low number on a scale or fitting into a certain dress size mean if you're not happy with your life? I'm the happiest (but certainly not the thinnest) I've ever been in my life and I've realized that losing 10 pounds and reaching that "perfect weight" doesn't matter as much as living life and embracing the important things like time with your friends and family and truly enjoying that chocolate chip cookie or extra glass of 🍾 Before this, I would have never posted an image (err, GIF) of me because I was self conscious about my curves, but now, I feel free, happy and grateful for this body and the way I treat myself and those around me 💋

On the eve of my 29th birthday, I stepped out of my comfort zone and finally did yoga. I couldn't have had a better first experience, thanks to @mindbodywise (a yoga therapist and instructor in NYC). Rachel led @yolyslu and I through a class and was there supporting us through every pose. I'm so grateful for people like her who have such a kind spirit. As for yoga- I'm officially hooked, and I can't wait to do it again!! Who knew it was so physically and mentally challenging- in a good way. Proud of my tree pose 🌲What's everyone's take on yoga? Tell me everything!

Took Luca for a nice long walk late this afternoon and ended up at the farmer’s market and picked up dinner: bell peppers, onions, garlic, broccoli, red potatoes, and chicken sausage 🥦 The red potatoes were too small to spiralize, so I cubed them and roasted them (seasoned with olive oil, garlic powder, salt and pepper) alongside the sausage at 425 degrees for 25 minutes. Meanwhile, I spiralized the bell peppers and onions and tossed them with the broccoli and garlic with olive oil, oregano, basil, red pepper flakes, salt and pepper. Stirred in the cooked sausage at the end and served it with the potatoes! Quick and easy dinner made with simple ingredients ✌🏼 And Luca even sat with us at the dinner table!! 👶🏻 Check him out (and watch me cook this dish) on IG stories! What’s everyone else having for dinner? 👇🏼

I shared my favorite photos from our maternity photoshoot over on @alissandrab today, and I couldn’t be happier that I did this shoot. 🤰🏻Swipe left to see more! 👉🏼 I’m so excited to share these photos with our son one day so he can see how absolutely blessed we felt and how much love we had for him even before he was brought into this world. 👶🏻 We are less than two weeks away from our due date, and as that date approaches, I’m feeling more and more ready to be a mother. And when I decided to do this shoot, I decided to do it in two parts: one ‘dressed up’ with Lu and one intimate with the bump. I wasn’t sure I’d share the photos with anyone else but Lu and I, but I’m so proud of my body and what it has done over these past 9 months, and I want every single pregnant woman out there to feel beautiful and confident at this stage of her life, so I decided to share! These photos bring such a smile to my face, and when people ask me, “What are you most excited for with having a baby?” my answer is, “To see Lu become a father!” I just can’t wait 👪 Photos by @eedwyer

No matter how busy I get, I always make the time to eat healthy, even if I only have 5 minutes! Lately, I've been coming home, spiralizing zucchini, and tossing it with pesto, chickpeas, and chopped broccoli. Some Tuesday motivation for anyone who needs it (like me!) I don’t feel as healthy as I usually do, and I felt like sharing my current struggle this morning, in case someone else is feeling it too. 💕 I’ve been struggling with getting back on track after my half marathon this past month- life has been happening, I’ve been busy with work, some family stuff has come up, and I’m focusing more on work right now than my own fitness. I set big goals for myself after the race and now, I’m realizing I forgot all about one of the principles that has guided me through my fit journey this whole time: little by little, a little becomes a lot. In the past, I used to demand so much of myself: I’m going to do a 1 hour intense workout every morning for a month or, “I’m going to not eat this or that for a week.” More often than not, those plans failed and I was left feeling defeated and frustrated. Finally, I accepted that what’s more impactful is all of the little steps forward you take - they ended up leading you closer to your end goals than the big pushes, because those usually end up thwarted by things like life. Plus, when life DOES get in the way, it’s comforting to know that the littles still help - and they’re more manageable. Focus on the littles, like eating healthy at one meal or running that extra 1 mile during a workout or saying no to dessert when out with friends. That all adds up to a lot 💪🏼 Tag a friend who may need to see this too!

Today was another unbelievable, humbling day. After meandering through Ubud, shopping, eating and soaking it all in, we went on a little detour to walk where we could see a view of some local rice fields. We followed signs and ended up at @sweetorangewarung, a spot that opened up only since this February. The owner started this little "warung" (basically a casual resto/diner) to help support this beautiful, quaint area and keep it clean. While they have a menu with some food and drinks (like this deliciously refreshing seltzer with ginger, mint and lime), they also offer discarded coconuts for sale that they have had local artisans first carve. You can buy one (less than $5 USD), decorate it, and have it hung on wire at this adorable place. All the proceeds go to supporting the community. Lu and I almost cried we were so touched. If you find yourself in Ubud, make sure you don't leave leave without checking out this haven. Oh and make sure you look for the coconut that says "Inspiralized Was Here." The people here are wonderful and we can't wait to explore other parts of Bali over the next couple of days ❤️🌴

Spiralizing broccoli is tricky- it's tough to find broccoli stems large enough for spiralizing (similar to carrots!) To ensure best spiralizing, aim for a broccoli stalk with a width of 2 inches or more and use Blade C! 🌀
