Heyyyyyyy everyone. SO. If you follow me on stories, you know that on Wednesday, I randomly “got” Bell’s Palsy, rendering half of my face paralyzed. It’s been quite the experience, and I’m trying not to freak out or worry too much. I’m seeing all the right doctors, getting bloodwork, trying acupuncture, drinking turmeric, and trying NOT to stress myself out, because apparently that’s what caused this, along with other factors like hormones from pregnancy, etc. Even though cooking is “work” most days, it’s what makes me feel the most relaxed and happy, so I’m doing that and trying not to stare at a computer for hours and accepting that I’m not going to be productive for the next couple of weeks (which, ironically, stresses me out!) I guess I didn’t realize what an overachiever I was until now. Someone is trying to tell me to slowwwwwwww down. I wanted to also hop on here and let you know that I started a separate Instagram account for my baby food journey, now that we’ve started Luca on solid foods! You can check that out on @inspiralizedkids, where I’ll be sharing this recipe for Potato Toast Dippers soon! Thanks to everyone for their kind messages, notes, and e-mails - I’ve read every single one and they’re making me feel very loved, supported, and like I’m not alone in this random medical “issue” (wtf?!) And to those who celebrate, happy Passover, Good Friday and happy Easter! It’s my birthday on April 1st, so I’ll be celebrating that with a crooked smile 🤪

The most empowering moment of my life was opening up my laptop the second I got home after quitting my corporate job and buying the domain name Inspiralized.com. ✨ I had absolutely no idea what would happen next, where Inspiralized would take me, but I had passion, determination, and a willingness to work my butt off and never look back. I knew I was the right person to spread the word about spiralizing and help others find their healthiest selves through eating spiralized veggies! 🌀 As simple and basic as that sounds, that’s still my mission today - to help people eat healthier, by spiralizing! Since that first day (June 25, 2013), a LOT has happened that I would have never dreamed of (like TWO New York Times best-selling cookbooks, what?!), a billboard in Times Square, my own office, and millions of monthly blog readers. I have my hard work and YOUR support to thank for all of it. Every last click, every last encouraging comment has pushed me forward and kept me going! Now, my next big move for Inspiralized is up, that again, I’m surprised myself it is happening: I’M GOING ON @HSN!!!!!! 🎉🎈Yes, I just announced it to my newsletter subscribers - I will be on live, national television..... spiralizing with @theinspiralizer and sharing recipes from my cookbooks,

It’s almost been 3 years since I started Inspiralized (June 26th marks the 3-year anniversary!) and I like to look back on what I’ve done each year and plan for an even better and bigger next year. As I was looking through old YouTube videos, I stumbled upon one of the first ones I made of my sweet potato noodle buns, made in December 2013, just about 5 months after starting Inspiralized. It made me realize that while this little brand I’m building has grown so much, so have I. Since this video, so much has happened - from becoming a NY Times bestselling author to getting married, I’ve learned so much about myself, my priorities, my body, and the woman I want to be. I’ve found my healthiest self and finally found peace with food and that has been the biggest accomplishment for me. I actually remember filming this original video (on the left) and wearing a baggy, dirty black sweater to hide my tummy because I had binge ate the night before and felt absolutely crappy and uncomfortable in my own skin. On the right, filmed just about a month ago, I was energized, happy, and fit. I think the most wonderful part about entrepreneurship isn’t necessarily the growth of your business, but the growth of yourself. At the very least, I got a better haircut! 💇🏻

Okay, it's the last cover reveal post before the FINAL reveal and giveaway of @theinspiralizer + cookbook. This image is of spiralized green bell peppers!
